title: Directorate's Emergency Rule
outcome: The Directorate exploits post-referendum chaos to declare emergency powers, suspending all forms of neighborhood self-governance. Their operatives restore rationing, shut down community forums, and enforce strict curfews, promising stability. Dissent is met with detainment and surveillance. Official propaganda reframes the crackdown as a necessary reset following the BCI’s failures. The Council becomes a figurehead, with directives handed down by the Directorate, polarizing citizens between fearful acceptance and covert resistance.

events.description: Directorate forces declare a 30-day emergency mandate, reinstating curfews and suspending neighborhood councils and forums.
Team of Directorate operatives cracks down on unauthorized public gatherings. Dissenters are detained for 'systemic destabilization.'
Utilities rationed under Directorate’s supervision, with resource access tied to compliance with emergency orders. Citizens show signs of quiet, nervous compliance.
Media broadcasts highlight the emergency as a move to 'restore order' after BCI failures; Council is sidelined, with all messaging controlled by the Directorate.
Underground resistance quietly forms, spreading leaflets and organizing secret aid networks, as ordinary citizens weigh survival against obedience.
